title: The chinese splash arts look like the free MMO's you see along the sides of dodgy websites
body:
Like seriously, who is approving this stuff? This appalling step backwards in quality and artistic cohesion is simply mind boggling. Why on earth is it ok for a champion to be a completely different person in 1/5 splashes for no reason? Stranger still is how a champion is allowed to randomly change to an anime character hat looks like I drew it (not good).

Seriously, this fiora splash looks like it came straight out of a cringe compilation.

http://imgur.com/wFHNboc

Some are really good, some are not.

lets be fair, a lot of them are based on our personal bias.
I think the new mid night ahri is much better and an upgrade to current midnight ahri. Yet many people disagree.

I really like the new blitzcrank where he sits on the top of a mountain of rumble as a Badass Champion (not as in lol champion, but CHAMPION). Yet, many people hate the new splash Art.

I really like the new Karma splashes. It shows Karma as happy, as enjoying life. While most people hate it, because "she's a deep character she should be fucking sad and pissed all the time. How dare they make a happy Karma". As if, character X had a harsh life, they must suffer for eternity and should never be allowed even a moment of happiness.

Tho, the general concuss seems to be that Mundo (Shrek), Fiora (Vampire lady) and baker Morgana (take a look at her mouth) are bad.  I'd also argue that some others are bad. But, again, its more of a bias and preference for most splashes.
I won't be surprised to find that someone likes some of the 3 I've listed above.

My main issue is that they literally photoshopped the gloves from the old splash art onto the new one, and also why is Blitzcrank just looking like War Machine X48I5 with boxing gloves. Blitzcrank isn't super violent in the lore, and the Boom Boom Blitz art currently there looks like he went through a rough fight instead of him being super polished and spotless while standing on a pile of mangled robots like it's nothing. The old art just has more character in my opinion.

The Mundo one is just... not Mundo, most of the proportions are way off and like you said, he kind of looks like Shrek.
Fiora's looks like copyright infringement straight from Castlevania.

Most of them I'm OK with, but the ones I'm not OK with are just so horrendously bad, not for the actual art quality but because it just doesn't feel like the champions they are supposed to represent.

Man, there are so many things wrong with this Fiora splash-art I don't even know where to begin.

First of all, Fiora has BLUE eyes.
Her hair is on the LEFT side of her face, not the right.
She does have lighter skin but is not deathly-pale.
She doesn't have glowy red gems.
She is fit but not anorexic.
She wears pink make-up and her jaw is wider.
Nightraven =/= Itachi Uchiha Raven
Her hair is straigh.
Her clothes are grey.
She has straps on her chest-piece going around her torso, holding a blade on her back.
And she most certainly doesn't look like some fan-art of a hip hentai from 2009.

doesn't matter.
Lux has yellow hair. Yet in Sailor Moon Galaxy Savior skin she has it pink.
Eye color change, hair color change, hair style and so on. Those are all objects which are subjects to change when a skin happens.
So, arguing such details is irrelevant. You can only argue those when they release the splash art and it doesn't match the in-game model. You don't know if they will also change the game model right now, so, again, details can't be argued over.

Now that I've got that out of the way. She doesn't look like a hentai ripoff. She looks gothic-vampirish.

And FINALLY that I got this out of the way. The splash art we currently have for Night Raven Fiora is much better than the Chinese one (which is really plain and meh).

Yes yes, and Malphite doesn't have arrows sticking out of him, and [insert another twenty petty complaints here]

I'm not sure how much time you spend looking at the splash-arts or how much it means to you, but I honestly couldn't care less. I only care what the in-game models look like, because they're the only part that are actually in the game.

Why do you assume that, because you don't care about certain thing, nobody cares about it? Some people love splash arts as much as they like the ingame models, and you are no one to tell them what they should care about.

Art is art and I can say that most of the artwork the Chinese made aren't bad.
However NA Lol has developed a philosophy and meaning behind what a splashart has to do and Chinese art works don't follow that which is why I don't approve of the Chinese splasharts although they're good.

What I mean is look at Riots splash arts, theres a small story or action scene in each one and they do what their supposed to do which is display a champion and tell you what its about just by looking at the splashart. The Chinese ones are nice but they don't do them, thats why I don't want Chinese splasharts EVEN if some of them are better than the original (not much but a few are actually better). ALSO that Bloodmoon Akali splashart change... I don't even play Akali but I loved that splashart and am sad that they're changing it.
The Karma ones are a prime example of this. Crappy anime with crappy colours. Crap.

To be honest I don't mind the Chinese Sun Karma .-.
The old one kinda made me cringe despite the model being ok.
I do disagree about the anime eyes, but I really like the movement in the newer one .3.

My main issues with the new Sun Goddess splash are the colours. The pose I like, the anime I GUESS I can live with, and I too like the movement. It could have been good. But the purples and pinks in the sky and pyramid don't look that great imo. In trying to look dynamic and interesting, it just sort of ends up clashing.

Nah, the picture is actually garbage. I had seen it before and I actually assumed it was fanart.

As a stand alone image the drawing is very nice. Very nice shading and color theme.

Ever heard of the rule of 3rds? Well if you draw three lines both horizontally and vertically across the paper any intersections make a good focus point. Having a person right in the middle of the image is really boring. (This is why a lot of artist don't center their subject)

Take Sandstorme Ekko for an example, https://cdn3.artstation.com/p/assets/images/images/000/760/159/large/joshua-brian-smith-sandstorm-ekko.jpg?1443930274, he isn't centered in the image but the angle of the picture makes your eyes draw to him as a focus point. 
For Fiora picture, yes it is lacking in the perspective isle, but the artist made the background lead your eyes to her to make her the focus of the picture.

Opinions will be opinions u.u
